summary: Gravatar (Globally Recognized Avatar) displays profile photos from gravatar.com for members who don't have uploaded photos in ChurchCRM.

sections.title: How it works
sections.content: When a member doesn't have an uploaded photo, ChurchCRM checks if they have a Gravatar associated with their email address. If a Gravatar exists, it displays that image. If not, the configured default image style is used.

sections.title: Default Image Styles
sections.content:
Choose what appears when no Gravatar exists:
• Mystery Person - Gray silhouette outline
• Identicon - Geometric pattern based on email
• MonsterID - Unique generated monster face
• Wavatar - Abstract generated face
• Retro - 8-bit arcade-style pixel art
• RoboHash - Unique generated robot
• Blank - Transparent (falls back to initials)

sections.title: Privacy Note
sections.content: Gravatar works by converting email addresses into a hash (MD5). The actual email address is never sent to Gravatar's servers - only the hash is used to look up the image.
